snippet: There are persistent reports of innocent people being tortured and killed by the police in Kandahar, creating a backlash that local people say has fed support for the Taliban.
abstract: Accusation by parents of Hazrat Ali that police in Kandahar, Afghanistan, tortured and killed their son while he was in custody has again focused attention on a wave of disappearances and deaths in the southern province; province's governor promises full investigation of case but human rights advocates call for a completely independent inquiry.

byline.contributor: An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: There are persistent reports of innocent people being tortured and killed by the police in Kandahar, creating a backlash that local people say has fed support for the Taliban.
